attributes.action: prevent TFL creating a congestion charging zone in Greenwich
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Plans to create a congestion charging zone in Greenwich would unfairly penalise Greenwich and Blackheath residents, who, according to a recent report, could be expected to pay between 10 and 100% of the charge.  

Plans to cut congestion in the area could be achieved equally well by charging a toll for the Blackwall Tunnel alone without the need for a wider congestion charging zone in the town centre.  

The TFL sponsored survey (unsurprisingly) does not give residents an option to oppose the scheme, but merely to choose between two alternatives.
